onset.Description: Onset of the go signal which is the disappearance of the cue bar

event-type.Description: Subject presses both buttons causing cue bar to start count-down display

Levels.cue: Subject presses both buttons causing cue bar to start count-down display
Levels.go: Bar disappears cueing the subject to make a choice about which hand to raise
Levels.right-raised: Subject releases right button and raises right hand
Levels.left-raised: Subject releases left button and raises left hand
Levels.left-raised-match: Subject raised left hand and computer presented image of left hand.
Levels.left-raised-nomatch: Subject raised left hand and computer presented image of right hand.
Levels.right-raised-match: Subject raised right hand and computer presented image of right hand.
Levels.right-raised-nomatch: Subject raised right hand and computer presented image of left hand.

HED.cue: Description/Subject presses both buttons causing cue bar to start count-down display, (Sensory-event, Visual, Cue, ((Rectangle, (Position, (Center-of, Screen)), (Size, Decreasing)))), (Agent-action, Experimental-participant, (Press, Hold-down, (Left-side, Button)), (Press, Hold-down, (Right-side, Button)))
HED.go: Description/Onset of the go signal which is the disappearance of the cue bar, Sensory-event, (Visual, Experimental-stimulus, Instructional, Signal-go, Rectangle)
HED.right-raised: Description/Subject raised right hand thereby releasing right button, (Agent-action, Experimental-participant, (Lift, (Right-side, Hand)), (Release, (Right-side, Button)))
HED.left-raised: Description/Subject raised left hand thereby releasing left button, (Agent-action, Experimental-participant, (Lift, (Left-side, Hand)), (Release, (Left-side, Button)))
HED.left-raised-match: Description/Computer presented image of left hand thereby matching a previously raised left hand, (Sensory-event, Visual, (Drawing, ID/left_hand.png,(Left-side, Hand)), (Feedback, (Intended-effect, Penalty)))
HED.left-raised-nomatch: Description/Computer presented image of left hand thereby not matching previously raised right hand, (Sensory-event, Visual, (Drawing, ID/right_hand.png, (Left-side, Hand)), (Feedback, (Intended-effect, Reward)))
HED.right-raised-match: Description/Computer presented image of right hand thereby matching a previously raised right hand, (Sensory-event, Visual, (Drawing, ID/right_hand.png,(Right-side, Hand)), (Feedback, (Intended-effect, Penalty)))
HED.right-raised-nomatch: Description/Computer presented image of right hand thereby not matching a previously raised left hand, (Sensory-event, Visual, (Drawing, ID/right_hand.png, (Right-side, Hand)), (Feedback, (Intended-effect, Reward)))

sample.Description: The sample within the EEG data at which an event occurred

stage.Description: The current stage of the experiment.

Levels.2: Stage 2. BCI was trained on data from stage 1.
Levels.3: Stage 3. BCI was trained on data from stages 1 and 2.

HED.2: Description/BCI was trained on data from stage 1., (Definition/Trained-on-random, (Experimental-condition)), Def/Trained-on-random
HED.3: Description/BCI was trained on data from stages 1 and 2., (Definition/Trained-on-all, (Experimental-condition)), Def/Trained-on-all

trial.Description: The number of the trial in the experiment.
trial.HED: Description/The number of the trial in the experiment, (Experimental-trial, Item-count/#)

latency.Description: Estimated beginning of the data chunk used for the BCI prediction with respect to the true event as measured by parallel port trigger in this trial.

bci_prediction.Description: Which hand did the BCI predict was raised in this trial.

Levels.left: BCI predicts participant raised left hand
Levels.right: BCI predicts participant raised right hand

HED.left: Description/BCI predicts participant raised left hand, Computed-prediction, (Computational-evidence, (Left-side, Hand))
HED.right: Description/BCI predicts participant raised right hand, Computed-prediction, (Computational-evidence, (Right-side, Hand))

bci_prediction_valid.Description: Did a prediction arrive on time (if not, a random prediction was made) in this trial.

Levels.2: Computational prediction was late so random prediction was used.

HED.1: Description/Computational prediction arrived on time, (Computational-agent, Predict)
HED.2: Description/Computational prediction was late so random prediction was used., Time-out, (Random, Predict)

n_repeated.Description: Number of trials that had to be repeated until the present trial because of invalid participant behavior (within this stage).
